args: Sun's down, but this town's\nstill plenty lively.
It certainly is—I can even hear what\nsounds to be a band playing.
So this is an Alberian festival, eh?\nWe shouldn't wait so long before\ncoming here again next time.
Ah, but this brings me back. I remember\nwhen I used to go to festivals with Botan.

She would challenge me in the
ring toss, carving challenges,
and all manner of other games.
She was quite serious about it, too.
So she's always been like that, has she?
Didn't expect to run into any fellow\ncountrymen out here.
I take it you're from Hinomoto?\nI mean, judgin' by the duds.
Yes, and I would assume the same of you.
Yep. I'm from Hinomoto, all right.
This is the first time I've ever met\nsomebody from Hinomoto besides Yaten!
Just don't get too cozy with Master Ieyasu.
If you are from Hinomoto, you must be\nfamiliar with the Twelve Wyrmclans?
They're basically the big-shots in\nHinomoto. Never thought I'd actually\nmeet one of 'em in the flesh.
It'd be rude of us not to extend every\ncourtesy to such a noble person.\nRight, Natalie?
Hell yeah, it'd be rude! C'mon, guys—\nI'll give you the ten-cent tour.
...So this is some manner of cured meat\nwrapped in bread? It is quite delicious.
I can taste salt, but there is also\na hint of fresh herb in the filling.
Yeah, they use some kind of local herb\nto really punch up the flavor.
Although they keep it pretty secret,\nso who knows what it actually is.
A shame—although I certainly understand\nwhy they would want to do so.
...Look at you hittin' every target—\nthe person running the stall seems\nready to faint dead away!
That was pretty damn fun for a kiddie toy.
Nice to use a bow every once in a while.
I was not aware of the depth of your\nskills with a bow, Addis.
In the future, perhaps you might compete\nwith me in some target shooting?
Don't think I'm a match for you, Master,\nbut if that's whatcha want, I'm game.
I look forward to it. ...Ah, but on another\nsubject, these candied apples are divine.
It's a good thing folks in this town\nalso enjoy candy apples.
If not, we would'a removed 'em\nfrom the food cart lineup.
Festivals belong to the place they're held.\nIf the locals don't enjoy an activity,\nthere's no point in having it.
Your level of passion when it comes to\nfestival planning is quite impressive.
Ah, how nice to spend some enjoyable\ntime in an unexpected place.
How long has it been since I last\nattended a town festival...?
You certainly seem to have your share of\ntroubles. I suppose ruling and governing\nreally take it out of a guy.
I cannot deny the truth of what you say.\nHowever, it is a path I chose myself.
And given that, I bear it gladly.
Your people must be happy\nto have a leader like you.
But you know, even if you are\nthe head of a Wyrmclan, you're\nstill just a human being.
And this isn't Hinomoto;\nsocial status doesn't matter when\nyou're at one of my festivals.
So maybe—just this once—you can\nforget your position, title, and all\nof the baggage that goes with it.
Just enjoy the festival as plain ol' Ieyasu.
If it's been a long time since you've been\nto a festival, try to approach it with the\njoy of a kid. Just for a night.
Every festival is a once-in-a-lifetime\nopportunity, after all—and you can't enjoy\ntoday's festival any day EXCEPT today.
So get out there and enjoy the\nhell out of it already!
Heh. Perhaps I could stand to learn a\nthing or two from Botan in this regard.
Might we return to that archery cart\nwe visited earlier?
Of course. Er, but why, if you\ndon't mind me asking?
If this is truly once-in-a-lifetime, I cannot\nwait for the future to challenge Addis.\nI must do so tonight!
Will you accept my challenge, Addis?
Just don't expect me to go easy on ya.
I shall serve as the judge.
Heh. I feel as though I understand a bit\nbetter now why Botan always seeks to\nchallenge me in various events.
It really is quite exciting to cut loose and\nlet one's whims take them where they will!
Well, we've got plenty of festival left\nfor you to let loose and enjoy yourself!
Very well. For tonight only, I shall return\nto the mindset I had as a young man.\nLet us enjoy this event to the fullest!
